questions.question: When an interviewer says, 'Tell me about yourself,' what should you talk about?
options: A brief summary of your education and interests related to the job
questions.correct_answer: A brief summary of your education and interests related to the job

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a face-to-face interview?
options: To meet the interviewer in person and discuss your fitness for the job
questions.correct_answer: To meet the interviewer in person and discuss your fitness for the job

questions.question: For a phone interview, what is the most important thing to ensure?
options: You are in a noisy place
You are in a quiet place with a good network connection
questions.correct_answer: You are in a quiet place with a good network connection

questions.question: A 'Tell me about yourself' answer should be...
questions.correct_answer: about 1-2 minutes long

questions.question: What should you do at the beginning of a face-to-face interview?
options: Greet the interviewer with a smile and a handshake
questions.correct_answer: Greet the interviewer with a smile and a handshake

questions.question: During a phone interview, it is important to speak...
questions.correct_answer: clearly and confidently

questions.question: When you 'Tell me about yourself,' you should mention your skills that...
options: are not related to the job
match the job you are applying for
questions.correct_answer: match the job you are applying for

questions.question: How should you dress for a face-to-face interview?
options: In clean, formal or business-casual clothes
In clothes you wear at home
questions.correct_answer: In clean, formal or business-casual clothes

questions.question: What should you have with you during a phone interview?
options: A copy of your resume and a pen and paper
questions.correct_answer: A copy of your resume and a pen and paper

questions.question: The 'Tell me about yourself' question is a way for the interviewer to...
options: get a quick overview of who you are
questions.correct_answer: get a quick overview of who you are

questions.question: What is good body language in a face-to-face interview?
options: Sitting up straight and making eye contact
questions.correct_answer: Sitting up straight and making eye contact

questions.question: What should you do at the end of a phone interview?
options: Thank the interviewer for their time
Ask when you will get the job
questions.correct_answer: Thank the interviewer for their time

questions.question: Your 'Tell me about yourself' answer should start with...
options: your name and a brief introduction
questions.correct_answer: your name and a brief introduction

questions.question: Listening carefully to the interviewer's questions is ______ in a face-to-face interview.
questions.correct_answer: very important

questions.question: Why is smiling important during a phone interview, even if they can't see you?
options: It can make your voice sound more positive and friendly.
questions.correct_answer: It can make your voice sound more positive and friendly.

questions.question: A good way to end your 'Tell me about yourself' answer is to...
options: connect your skills to why you are a good fit for the job
questions.correct_answer: connect your skills to why you are a good fit for the job

questions.question: What should you bring with you to a face-to-face interview?
options: Copies of your resume and a notepad
questions.correct_answer: Copies of your resume and a notepad

questions.question: How should you answer the phone for a scheduled phone interview?
options: By saying 'Hello?' in a confused tone
With a professional greeting, like 'Hello, this is [Your Name].'
questions.correct_answer: With a professional greeting, like 'Hello, this is [Your Name].'

questions.question: Which of these is a good point to include when you 'Tell me about yourself'?
options: Your latest academic achievement or relevant project
A story about your last holiday
A complaint about your previous job
questions.correct_answer: Your latest academic achievement or relevant project

questions.question: Arriving ______ for a face-to-face interview is important.
questions.correct_answer: a little early (10-15 minutes)

questions.question: What should you do if you miss a word the interviewer said during a phone call?
options: Politely ask them to repeat the question
questions.correct_answer: Politely ask them to repeat the question

questions.question: Your 'Tell me about yourself' answer should be...
questions.correct_answer: practiced but sound natural

questions.question: What is the purpose of asking 'Do you have any questions for us?' at the end of an interview?
options: To see if you are interested and have done your research
questions.correct_answer: To see if you are interested and have done your research

questions.question: A phone interview is often the ______ stage of the hiring process.
questions.correct_answer: first

questions.question: It is a good idea to research the ______ before any type of interview.
questions.correct_answer: company

questions.question: A firm handshake in a face-to-face interview shows...
questions.correct_answer: confidence

questions.question: During a phone interview, it is important to avoid...
questions.correct_answer: interrupting the interviewer

questions.question: What is the best way to structure your 'Tell me about yourself' answer?
questions.correct_answer: Past - Present - Future

questions.question: Turning off your mobile phone is essential before a ______ interview.
questions.correct_answer: face-to-face

questions.question: The main challenge in a phone interview is that the interviewer cannot see your...
questions.correct_answer: body language

questions.question: When you 'Tell me about yourself', you are giving your personal...
questions.correct_answer: elevator pitch

questions.question: At the end of a face-to-face interview, you should...
options: thank the interviewer for their time
questions.correct_answer: thank the interviewer for their time

questions.question: A phone interview is also known as a phone ______.
questions.correct_answer: screening

questions.question: Your 'Tell me about yourself' answer should be tailored to the...
options: company and the specific job role
questions.correct_answer: company and the specific job role

questions.question: Giving short, one-word answers in a face-to-face interview is...
questions.correct_answer: a bad idea

questions.question: The tone of your voice is very important in a ______ interview.
questions.correct_answer: phone

questions.question: It is a bad idea to mention your ______ when asked to tell about yourself, unless asked.
questions.correct_answer: weaknesses

questions.question: What does being 'punctual' for an interview mean?
questions.correct_answer: Being on time

questions.question: What is the purpose of a phone interview?
options: To shortlist candidates for the next round
questions.correct_answer: To shortlist candidates for the next round

questions.question: When you talk about your past in the 'Tell me about yourself' answer, you should focus on...
questions.correct_answer: relevant experience and education

questions.question: A face-to-face interview allows the interviewer to assess your non-verbal ______.
questions.correct_answer: cues

questions.question: It is a good idea to ______ the interviewer's name for a phone interview.
questions.correct_answer: remember and use

questions.question: When you talk about your future in the 'Tell me about yourself' answer, you should mention your...
options: career goals and how they align with the company
questions.correct_answer: career goals and how they align with the company

questions.question: A positive attitude is ______ in a face-to-face interview.
questions.correct_answer: contagious and helpful

questions.question: What should you do immediately after a phone interview?
questions.correct_answer: Send a brief thank-you email

questions.question: The 'Tell me about yourself' question is often the ______ question in an interview.
questions.correct_answer: first

questions.question: Being respectful and polite to everyone you meet at the office, including the receptionist, is important for a ______ interview.
questions.correct_answer: face-to-face

questions.question: For a phone interview, it is wise to have a ______ of water nearby.
questions.correct_answer: glass

questions.question: A good 'Tell me about yourself' answer should sound like...
questions.correct_answer: a confident conversation

questions.question: Which of these is a key component of a face-to-face interview?
questions.correct_answer: All of the above

questions.question: What is a 'behavioral interview' question designed to assess?
options: Your past behavior as an indicator of future performance
questions.correct_answer: Your past behavior as an indicator of future performance

questions.question: A 'panel interview' is an interview with...
options: several interviewers at the same time
questions.correct_answer: several interviewers at the same time

questions.question: What is the most important technical aspect to check before a 'video interview'?
questions.correct_answer: Your internet connection and camera/microphone

questions.question: 'Tell me about a time you had to work with a difficult team member.' This is an example of a ______ question.
questions.correct_answer: behavioral

questions.question: In a panel interview, who should you make eye contact with when answering a question?
options: Only the person who asked the question
The whole panel, focusing on the person who asked
questions.correct_answer: The whole panel, focusing on the person who asked

questions.question: Where should you look during a video interview?
options: At your own image on the screen
At the interviewer's image on the screen
questions.correct_answer: Directly into the camera lens

questions.question: The 'STAR' method is a way to answer behavioral questions. What does 'S' stand for?
questions.correct_answer: Situation

questions.question: A key challenge in a panel interview is...
options: managing questions from different people with different roles
questions.correct_answer: managing questions from different people with different roles

questions.question: What should be in the background of your video interview?
options: A lot of people walking around
questions.correct_answer: A professional and non-distracting background

questions.question: In the STAR method, what does 'A' stand for?
questions.correct_answer: Action

questions.question: Why might a company use a panel interview?
options: To save time and get multiple perspectives at once
To make the candidate more nervous
Because they have too many interviewers
questions.correct_answer: To save time and get multiple perspectives at once

questions.question: In a video interview, your non-verbal cues, like nodding and smiling, are...
questions.correct_answer: still very important

questions.question: When a behavioral question asks about a failure, you should...
options: blame someone else for the failure
describe the failure and what you learned from it
questions.correct_answer: describe the failure and what you learned from it

questions.question: After a panel interview, it is a good idea to...
options: send a thank-you note to only one interviewer
send a personalized thank-you note to each interviewer
questions.correct_answer: send a personalized thank-you note to each interviewer

questions.question: What is a 'one-way' or 'asynchronous' video interview?
options: A live conversation with an interviewer
An interview where you record your answers to preset questions
An interview where you cannot speak
questions.correct_answer: An interview where you record your answers to preset questions

questions.question: The 'R' in the STAR method stands for...
questions.correct_answer: Result

questions.question: In a panel interview, if two people ask a question at once, you should...
options: answer both at the same time
politely ask one to wait while you answer the other
questions.correct_answer: politely ask one to wait while you answer the other

questions.question: How can you show you are actively listening during a video interview?
options: By looking away from the screen
By nodding and using facial expressions
questions.correct_answer: By nodding and using facial expressions

questions.question: 'Describe a situation where you had to work under pressure.' The best answer to this behavioral question would include...
options: a brief story with a positive outcome
a story where you failed completely
questions.correct_answer: a brief story with a positive outcome

questions.question: The members of an interview panel might be from different departments, such as HR and...
questions.correct_answer: the technical team

questions.question: It is a good idea to do a ______ before your actual video interview.
questions.correct_answer: test call with a friend

questions.question: The STAR method helps you to structure your answers to ______ questions.
questions.correct_answer: behavioral

questions.question: What is the main advantage of a panel interview for the company?
options: It is more personal for the candidate.
It provides a more diverse and comprehensive assessment of the candidate.
It is less stressful for the candidate.
questions.correct_answer: It provides a more diverse and comprehensive assessment of the candidate.

questions.question: What is the biggest challenge of a one-way video interview?
options: You can see the interviewer's reaction.
You cannot ask clarifying questions or build rapport.
questions.correct_answer: You cannot ask clarifying questions or build rapport.

questions.question: To prepare for behavioral questions, you should think of specific ______ from your past experience.
questions.correct_answer: examples and stories

questions.question: In a panel interview, it's important to get the ______ of each interviewer if possible.
questions.correct_answer: name and role

questions.question: Lighting is important for a video interview. The main light source should be...
questions.correct_answer: in front of you

questions.question: 'Tell me about a time you showed leadership.' The 'Result' part of your STAR answer should explain...
options: what the outcome was and what you learned
questions.correct_answer: what the outcome was and what you learned

questions.question: What should you do if one panel member seems uninterested or distracted?
options: Continue to address the whole panel professionally
questions.correct_answer: Continue to address the whole panel professionally

questions.question: The dress code for a video interview is generally...
options: casual, since you are at home
the same as for a face-to-face interview
only formal on the top half
questions.correct_answer: the same as for a face-to-face interview

questions.question: Behavioral questions often start with phrases like 'Give an example of a time when...' or...
questions.correct_answer: 'Tell me about a time when...'

questions.question: A panel interview can feel intimidating. What is the best way to manage this?
options: By remembering they are all just people and focusing on your answers
questions.correct_answer: By remembering they are all just people and focusing on your answers

questions.question: What should you do if your internet connection fails during a video interview?
options: Try to reconnect and have a backup plan, like the interviewer's phone number.
Blame the company for the problem.
questions.correct_answer: Try to reconnect and have a backup plan, like the interviewer's phone number.

questions.question: The 'Task' part of the STAR method is where you describe...
options: your goal or what you had to achieve
questions.correct_answer: your goal or what you had to achieve

questions.question: Why might a panel have members with very different questioning styles (e.g., one friendly, one aggressive)?
options: Because they don't like each other
To see how you react under different types of pressure
questions.correct_answer: To see how you react under different types of pressure

questions.question: Before a video interview, it's important to close unnecessary ______ on your computer.
questions.correct_answer: applications and tabs

questions.question: 'Give an example of a goal you reached.' This behavioral question is assessing your...
options: ability to set and achieve goals
questions.correct_answer: ability to set and achieve goals

questions.question: In a panel interview, it's a good sign if...
options: the interviewers start discussing your skills among themselves
questions.correct_answer: the interviewers start discussing your skills among themselves

questions.question: What is a major advantage of a video interview for a candidate?
options: It saves travel time and cost.
questions.correct_answer: It saves travel time and cost.

questions.question: The STAR method ensures your answers are...
questions.correct_answer: structured, specific, and complete

questions.question: If you are asked the same question by two different panel members, you should...
options: refuse to answer the second time
politely acknowledge the question was asked and give a consistent, perhaps slightly rephrased, answer
tell them they already asked that
questions.correct_answer: politely acknowledge the question was asked and give a consistent, perhaps slightly rephrased, answer

questions.question: What is a key difference between a phone interview and a video interview?
options: In a video interview, your appearance and body language matter.
A phone interview is more formal.
A video interview is always shorter.
questions.correct_answer: In a video interview, your appearance and body language matter.

questions.question: 'Tell me about a time you had to learn a new skill quickly.' This question tests your...
questions.correct_answer: adaptability and ability to learn

questions.question: A panel interview is often the ______ stage in the interview process.
questions.correct_answer: final

questions.question: In a one-way video interview, you should pay close attention to the...
questions.correct_answer: time limit for each answer

questions.question: The purpose of behavioral questions is to get ______ evidence of your skills.
questions.correct_answer: concrete

questions.question: In a panel interview, if one person is from HR and another is a technical manager, their questions will likely be...
options: focused on different areas (e.g., personality vs. technical skills)
questions.correct_answer: focused on different areas (e.g., personality vs. technical skills)

questions.question: The term 'virtual interview' can refer to a...
questions.correct_answer: phone or video interview

questions.question: Preparing 5-6 strong examples using the STAR method is a good strategy for ______ interviews.
questions.correct_answer: behavioral

questions.question: A key skill for a panel interview is to remain calm and ______.
questions.correct_answer: composed

questions.question: In a behavioral interview, how do you handle a question about a time you failed if you can't think of a major failure?
options: Describe a small, genuine mistake and focus on the learning and improvement that resulted from it.
Make up a dramatic story about a huge failure.
questions.correct_answer: Describe a small, genuine mistake and focus on the learning and improvement that resulted from it.

questions.question: During a panel interview, if one interviewer clearly disagrees with another's assessment of your answer, what should you do?
options: Take a side and agree with one of them.
Remain neutral and confident in your original answer, without getting involved in their disagreement.
Tell them they are both wrong.
questions.correct_answer: Remain neutral and confident in your original answer, without getting involved in their disagreement.

questions.question: How do you build rapport and show personality in a pre-recorded, one-way video interview?
options: By being very serious and robotic.
By speaking with enthusiasm and energy, and looking directly at the camera as if talking to a person.
You cannot build rapport in a one-way interview.
By reading your answers from a script.
questions.correct_answer: By speaking with enthusiasm and energy, and looking directly at the camera as if talking to a person.

questions.question: How should your 'Tell me about yourself' answer differ for a creative role versus an analytical role?
options: It should be exactly the same.
For a creative role, emphasize innovation and storytelling; for an analytical role, emphasize data and problem-solving.
For a creative role, you should sing your answer.
For an analytical role, you should list only numbers.
questions.correct_answer: For a creative role, emphasize innovation and storytelling; for an analytical role, emphasize data and problem-solving.

questions.question: How can you effectively use pauses during a phone interview?
options: Use brief pauses to gather your thoughts, which shows you are being thoughtful rather than just rushing an answer.
Use very long and awkward pauses.
questions.correct_answer: Use brief pauses to gather your thoughts, which shows you are being thoughtful rather than just rushing an answer.

questions.question: What is the best strategy to answer the behavioral question: 'Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a supervisor'?
options: Describe the conflict by focusing on how the supervisor was wrong.
State that you have never had a conflict.
Describe the situation professionally, focusing on the respectful resolution and positive outcome.
questions.correct_answer: Describe the situation professionally, focusing on the respectful resolution and positive outcome.

questions.question: In a panel interview, how can you identify the 'power player' or key decision-maker?
options: By who is the most senior or who other panelists defer to.
questions.correct_answer: By who is the most senior or who other panelists defer to.

questions.question: In a video interview, what is the 'framing' of your shot?
options: The picture frame on your wall.
How you are positioned in the camera's view, typically from the chest up.
questions.correct_answer: How you are positioned in the camera's view, typically from the chest up.

questions.question: An interviewer asks 'What is your greatest weakness?' in a face-to-face interview. What is the best approach?
options: Mention a real but manageable weakness and show how you are working to improve it.
Mention a weakness that is actually a strength, like 'I work too hard.'
Mention a critical weakness that makes you unfit for the job.
questions.correct_answer: Mention a real but manageable weakness and show how you are working to improve it.

questions.question: The 'Tell me about yourself' question is also known as the 'elevator pitch'. Why?
options: Because you should give it in an elevator.
Because it should be a short, compelling summary of yourself that you could deliver in a short elevator ride.
Because it should be very long and detailed.
questions.correct_answer: Because it should be a short, compelling summary of yourself that you could deliver in a short elevator ride.

questions.question: The 'Result' part of your STAR answer should ideally be...
options: quantifiable with numbers or specific outcomes
questions.correct_answer: quantifiable with numbers or specific outcomes

questions.question: What is a 'stress interview', which might be simulated in a panel format?
options: A very relaxing and friendly interview.
An interview where the panel intentionally creates a stressful environment to test your composure.
An interview about your personal stress.
An interview that is very short.
questions.correct_answer: An interview where the panel intentionally creates a stressful environment to test your composure.

questions.question: How do you convey enthusiasm in a phone interview without visual cues?
options: By speaking in a monotone voice.
Through vocal variety, a positive tone, and expressing interest in your words.
You cannot convey enthusiasm in a phone interview.
questions.correct_answer: Through vocal variety, a positive tone, and expressing interest in your words.

questions.question: What is a major risk of giving a very rehearsed 'Tell me about yourself' answer?
options: It might sound robotic and insincere.
The interviewer will be very impressed.
questions.correct_answer: It might sound robotic and insincere.

questions.question: In a face-to-face interview, mirroring the interviewer's body language slightly can help to...
options: build rapport and a subconscious connection
show that you are not listening
questions.correct_answer: build rapport and a subconscious connection

questions.question: A behavioral question like 'Describe a time you had to persuade a team to do something they didn't want to' assesses your...
questions.correct_answer: communication and influencing skills

questions.question: If a panel interview includes a presentation, what is the most critical part of your preparation?
options: Anticipating questions from different perspectives (e.g., financial, technical).
Making the presentation as long as possible.
questions.correct_answer: Anticipating questions from different perspectives (e.g., financial, technical).

questions.question: What is 'active listening' during a phone interview?
options: Providing short verbal cues like 'I see' or 'That's interesting' to show you are engaged.
Thinking about your next answer while the interviewer is talking.
questions.correct_answer: Providing short verbal cues like 'I see' or 'That's interesting' to show you are engaged.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of a video interview from the company's perspective?
options: To make the hiring process more difficult.
To screen a large number of candidates efficiently while still getting visual cues.
To test a candidate's internet speed.
To save money on office space.
questions.correct_answer: To screen a large number of candidates efficiently while still getting visual cues.

questions.question: Your 'Tell me about yourself' should not just list your resume, but should...
options: tell a compelling story that connects your past, present, and future
be a list of your hobbies
be a summary of your family history
be a list of your weaknesses
questions.correct_answer: tell a compelling story that connects your past, present, and future

questions.question: A follow-up question to a behavioral answer (e.g., 'What would you do differently next time?') is designed to test your...
questions.correct_answer: ability for self-reflection and learning

questions.question: A panel interview is often used for senior roles to ensure...
options: a consensus is reached among key stakeholders
the process takes a very long time
the candidate has a lot of friends in the company
questions.correct_answer: a consensus is reached among key stakeholders

questions.question: In a one-way video interview, how can you make your answers engaging without an audience?
options: By speaking in a flat monotone
By using vocal variety, hand gestures, and a conversational tone
By reading directly from a script
By making your answers very short
questions.correct_answer: By using vocal variety, hand gestures, and a conversational tone

questions.question: A key non-verbal cue in a face-to-face interview is 'posture'. An open posture (not crossing your arms) conveys...
questions.correct_answer: confidence and receptiveness

questions.question: What is the best way to prepare for a phone interview?
options: By not preparing at all to sound natural.
By preparing key points and answers, and practicing them out loud.
By writing a full script and reading it.
By just researching the company's location.
questions.correct_answer: By preparing key points and answers, and practicing them out loud.

questions.question: The 'Action' part of your STAR answer should focus on...
questions.correct_answer: the specific actions YOU took

questions.question: If a panel interviewer asks a question you don't understand, you should...
options: ask another panelist what they meant
questions.correct_answer: politely ask for clarification

questions.question: What is a major pitfall of a video interview?
options: The potential for technical glitches to disrupt the flow
The ability to save on travel time
The interviewer can see your body language
questions.correct_answer: The potential for technical glitches to disrupt the flow

questions.question: A good 'Tell me about yourself' answer will seamlessly lead into...
options: why you are a perfect fit for this specific role
questions.correct_answer: why you are a perfect fit for this specific role

questions.question: How do you handle an illegal or inappropriate question in a face-to-face interview?
options: Politely deflect the question and redirect the conversation to your professional qualifications
Walk out of the interview immediately
Get angry and argue with the interviewer
questions.correct_answer: Politely deflect the question and redirect the conversation to your professional qualifications

questions.question: A behavioral interview is based on the premise that...
options: past performance is the best predictor of future performance
what you say you will do is what you will do
technical skills are the only thing that matters
your personality is fixed and cannot be assessed
questions.correct_answer: past performance is the best predictor of future performance

questions.question: In a panel interview, if you have a strong disagreement with one member's technical question, you should...
options: politely present your different technical reasoning with justification
agree with them to avoid conflict
questions.correct_answer: politely present your different technical reasoning with justification

questions.question: A good way to end a phone interview is to reiterate your ______ for the role.
questions.correct_answer: enthusiasm

questions.question: A 'situational interview' question asks what you ______ do in a hypothetical situation.
questions.correct_answer: would

questions.question: The most important part of your 'Tell me about yourself' answer for a results-oriented company is to include...
questions.correct_answer: quantifiable achievements

questions.question: The STAR method is crucial because it prevents you from giving ______ answers.
questions.correct_answer: vague and general

questions.question: A successful panel interview requires you to be confident, knowledgeable, and...
questions.correct_answer: adaptable

questions.question: In a video interview, minimizing distractions in your environment is key to showing...
options: that you have a busy house
questions.correct_answer: your professionalism and focus

questions.question: A 'case interview', often used in consulting, is a type of interview where you are given a business problem to...
questions.correct_answer: solve

questions.question: What is the ultimate goal of the 'Tell me about yourself' answer?
options: To get the interviewer to like you as a person
To pique the interviewer's interest and make them want to know more
To answer the question as quickly as possible
questions.correct_answer: To pique the interviewer's interest and make them want to know more

questions.question: The best stories for behavioral questions are recent and...
options: show you in a bad light
demonstrate skills relevant to the job
questions.correct_answer: demonstrate skills relevant to the job

questions.question: How can you turn a potentially negative panel interview (e.g., very critical questions) into a positive?
options: By staying calm, professional, and treating it as an opportunity to demonstrate how you handle pressure
By agreeing with all the criticism
questions.correct_answer: By staying calm, professional, and treating it as an opportunity to demonstrate how you handle pressure

questions.question: The closing of a phone interview should include thanking the interviewer and asking about the...
questions.correct_answer: next steps in the process

questions.question: The main purpose of a mock interview is to...
options: practice and get feedback in a low-stakes environment
questions.correct_answer: practice and get feedback in a low-stakes environment

questions.question: A sophisticated 'Tell me about yourself' answer connects your past experiences to your present skills and then to your...
options: future career aspirations that align with the company's goals
questions.correct_answer: future career aspirations that align with the company's goals

questions.question: Behavioral questions are designed to move beyond theoretical answers and get to...
questions.correct_answer: actual, demonstrated behavior

questions.question: A key skill in a panel interview is synthesizing information from multiple questions to...
options: understand the company's overall priorities and challenges
questions.correct_answer: understand the company's overall priorities and challenges

questions.question: How can you use your physical space to your advantage in a video interview?
options: By having a very distracting background
By placing notes strategically out of the camera's view
By sitting very far from the camera
By having other people in the room
questions.correct_answer: By placing notes strategically out of the camera's view

questions.question: A face-to-face interview is a two-way street; it's also your opportunity to...
options: assess if the company is a good fit for you
questions.correct_answer: assess if the company is a good fit for you

questions.question: Ultimately, all interview types are designed to answer one fundamental question:
options: 'Can this candidate do the job and will they fit into our team?'
questions.correct_answer: 'Can this candidate do the job and will they fit into our team?'
